intro: Psychotria bracteata var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, known for its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often characterized by a smooth texture and a dark green coloration. The species is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance in certain indigenous cultures.
